title: Two carts sticking together after collision

content.question: Cart <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> travels toward cart <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, which is initially at rest. The two carts stick together after the collision. The position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the center of mass of cart <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is recorded at equal time intervals before and after the collision, as shown above. Based on the data, what can be concluded about the relative masses of carts <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="m sub A is greater than m sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m sub A is less than m sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m sub A equals m sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
The answer cannot be determined without knowing the initial speed of cart <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="m sub A is greater than m sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
